September 27,1961
Dr. Maurice F. Seay, Director
, Division of Education
fWJ
250 Champion Street
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Maurice;
Enclosed is a copy of the pilot issue of Educational Radio-TV # just
publish** by the NAEB.
last April, our Board of Directors, realising that there is a real need
for a magazine of this soft, ( a need not being filled by any other
periodical ), authorised the staff to proceed with the publication of
a pilot issue. It was realised at the time that such a magazine would
cost a considerable amount of money, but we felt that. If we did not
fill this veld in the educational broadcasting Held, someone with
purely commercial interests might well do so* This magasine, as you
can see, is intended to serve a function that neither our more scholar¬
ly Journal nor our * ‘family-house-organ • * Newsletter can hope to
provide. Ihe advertising space In this pilot issue was sold to some¬
thing less than actual cost, simply to have an Issue that would reflect
what we have In mind to such a publication if we can establish it cm
a permanent basis.
We sincerely believe that such a magazine is the next logical step
in orderly improvement of our publication program, which has been
possible during the past two years thanks to the funds provided to
this purpose by the W. K* Kellogg Foundation* The $10,000 which has
been earmarked annually in the Kellogg grant to publications has
permitted us to hire a full-time editor, upgrade the quality of the
Journal, and make complimentary copies available to educational
leaders throughout the nation*
